intro: Microchilus rioitayanus, commonly known as the Rioitayanus fern, is a rare and delicate plant native to the cloud forests of northern South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length.
